english.segment1: Up Calvary's mountain one dreadful morn. Walked Christ my Savior, weary and worn. Facing for sinners, death on the cross. That He might save them from endless loss
english.segment2: Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him on Calvary's tree. Wounded and bleeding, for sinners pleading. Blind and unheeding, dying for me
english.segment3: "Father, forgive them," my Savior prayed. Even while His lifeblood flowed fast away. Praying for sinners while in such woe. No one but Jesus ever loved so
english.segment4: Copyright © Casting Crowns. Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him on Calvary's tree. Wounded and bleeding, for sinners pleading. Blind and unheeding, dying for me. Dying for me
english.segment5: Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him on Calvary's tree. Wounded and bleeding, for sinners pleading. Blind and unheeding, dying for me
english.segment6: Oh, how I love Him, Savior and Friend. How can my praises ever find end?. Through years unnumbered on Heaven's shore. My songs shall praise Him forevermore
english.segment7: Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him on Calvary's tree. Wounded and bleeding, for sinners pleading. Blind and unheeding, dying for me
english.segment8: Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him on Calvary's tree. Wounded and bleeding, for sinners pleading. Blind and unheeding, dying for me
english.segment9: Blessed Redeemer, precious Redeemer. Seems now I see Him
